DOC.brief_summary: To determine significance simple bedside clinical test ( chest wall tenderness ) exclude myocardial ischemia different demographic group .
DOC.brief_title: Usefulness Chest Wall Tenderness Bedside Test Exclude Acute Coronary Syndrome Different Demographic Groups
DOC.detailed_description: When patient present acute chest pain ER University Hospital Zurich , study physician charge , act simultaneously one four attend clinical physician , perform physical examination accord routine clinical practice . The physical examination include test chest wall tenderness : Palpation chest wall tenderness lie 30Â° elevation chest position . Flat index standardize pressure spontaneous maximum pain report ( reproducible vs. reproducible pain vs. pain ) . Negative control ( right side chest mid-clavicle intercostal 6/7 ) , reproducible vs. reproducible pain vs. pain . The physician , blind final diagnosis time physical examination , also record patient history include study interview use standardize study questionnaire .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criterion : All patient age 18 year present lead symptom first time recurrent acute chest pain emergency room Department Internal Medicine , University Hospital Zurich . Exclusion criterion : Missing informed consent . Cardiopulmonary unstable patient . No self report chest pain . Recent thoracic surgery within1 year , inflammatory joint disease , fibromyalgia , cardiogenic shock .
